comments.body: why you need your own copy of kube-apiserver.manifest? same with below other .manifest files for other master components?

The kube-apiserver and kube-constroller-manager manifest in cluster/saltbase/salt/ have a couple of volumeMounts and volumes that does not work in our images. So, I have to remove them and make separate copies under cluster/gce/trusty/kube-manifests. For all other manifests, I directly copy them from cluster/saltbase/salt.
Which volumes & volumeMounts you removed here? My concern is that we create too many duplicated configs with small treaks.

I removed "/usr/share/ssl", "/usr/ssl", "/usr/lib/ssl" and "/usr/local/openssl". In addition to it, I also changed mount path /srv/kubernetes to /etc/srv/kubernetes. 

In this PR, these two manifests are the only duplicated configs. An option is to make the parts mentioned above in these two files configurable. More generally, I think we should remove the  copies in dirs cluster/gce/<coreos and trusty>/kube-manifests, and all distros only use the manifests copied from the real source cluster/saltbase/salt/. That is why I added a TODO in build/common.sh (in this PR) saying we should unify the generation of manifests.

@dchen1107 , I add a TODO in build/common.sh for getting rid of using separate manifest copies in trusty. After this PR is merged for 1.2, I will make another PR to address it, either cherry-picking it for 1.2 or for the next patch release of 1.2
